title: Think Twice Before Taking Large Student Loans
sub_head: Debt throttles students’ ability to start their economic lives while placing their parents’ ability to retire in grave doubt.
body:
I shudder for the graduates and parents who have saddled themselves with six-figure debt to the government that accrues above-market interest, is difficult to repay or renegotiate and is essentially nondischargeable in bankruptcy (“Why Congress Won’t Tackle Student Debt,” Page One, Dec. 9).
During my 20 years on the bankruptcy bench, I presided over many student-loan cases of people who had borrowed tens or hundreds of thousands of dollars that they couldn’t pay. There’s a reason no rational commercial lender would have made these loans: There’s no way these borrowers will earn enough to repay them. Sadly, there was little I could do for these unfortunate people.
